content.text:
# 2024 Texas Republican presidential primary

Trump
Haley
| image1 = January 2025 Official Presidential Portrait of Donald J. Trump.jpg
| candidate1 = Donald Trump
| color1 = 283681
| home_state1 = Florida
| popular_vote1 = 1,808,269
| percentage1 = 77.84%
| delegate_count1 = 161
| image2 = Nikki Haley (53299447738) (cropped).jpg
| candidate2 = Nikki Haley
| color2 = fe6100
| home_state2 = South Carolina
| popular_vote2 = 405,472
| percentage2 = 17.45%
| delegate_count2 = 0
}}
The 2024 Texas Republican presidential primary was held on March 5, 2024, as part of the Republican Party primaries for the 2024 presidential election. 161 delegates to the 2024 Republican National Convention were allocated on a winner-take-most basis. The contest was held on Super Tuesday alongside primaries in 14 other states. Trump ultimately won all 161 delegates, while winning every county in the state except for Kent County.
Candidates
The filing deadline was December 11, 2023. The following candidates filed:
* Ryan Binkley (withdrew on February 27, 2024)
* Chris Christie (withdrew on January 10, 2024)
* Ron DeSantis (withdrew on January 21, 2024)
* Nikki Haley
* Asa Hutchinson (withdrew on January 16, 2024)
* Vivek Ramaswamy (withdrew on January 15, 2024)
* David Stuckenberg
* Donald Trump
* Uncommitted
Endorsements
* Lamar Smith, TX-21 (1987–2019)
State representative
* Matt Schaefer, District 6 (2013–present)
}}
(2015–2021) and former 2024 Republican presidential candidate
* Lamar Smith,  (1987-2019)  (previously endorsed DeSantis)
* Mac Thornberry,  (1995-2021)
State Senator
* Florence Shapiro, Texas Senate, District 8 (1995–2013)
State Representative
* Kyle Kacal, District 12 (2013–present)
* Joe Straus, Speaker of the Texas House of Representative (2009–2019)
Local officials
*Dee Margo, Mayor of El Paso (2017-2021)
*Mattie Parker, mayor of Fort Worth (2021-Present)
*Betsy Price, mayor of Fort Worth (2011-2021)
Notable individual
* John Hagee, pastor and televangelist
}}
}}
U.S. Representatives
* Jodey Arrington,  TX-19 (2017–present)
* Brian Babin, TX-36 (2015–present)
* Michael C. Burgess, TX-26 (2003–present)
* John Carter, TX-31 (2003–present)
* Monica De La Cruz, TX-15 (2023–present)
* Pat Fallon, TX-04 (2021–present)
* Mayra Flores, TX-34 (2022–2023)
* Tony Gonzales, TX-23 (2021–present)
* Louie Gohmert, TX-01 (2005–2023)
* Lance Gooden, TX-05 (2019–present)
* Wesley Hunt, TX-38 (2023–present)
* Ronny Jackson, TX-13 (2021–present)
* Troy Nehls, TX-22 (2021–present)
* August Pfluger, TX-11 (2021–present)
* Keith Self, TX-03 (2023–present)
* Pete Sessions, TX-17 (2021–present)
* Beth Van Duyne, TX-24 (2021–present)
* Randy Weber, TX-14 (2013–present)
* Roger Williams, TX-25 (2013–present)
State executive officials
*Greg Abbott, Governor of Texas (2015–present)
*Dawn Buckingham, Land Commissioner (2023–present)
*Sid Miller, Agriculture Commissioner (2015–present)
*Dan Patrick, Lieutenant Governor (2015–present)
*Ken Paxton, Attorney General (2015–present)
State representative
* Charles Anderson, District 56 (2005–present)
